abstract: The hedge fund manager William Ackman had criticized Robert A. McDonald, the chief, for the company’s poor stock performance.
snippet: The hedge fund manager William Ackman had criticized Robert A. McDonald, the chief, for the company’s poor stock performance.
lead_paragraph: In a surprise move, Procter & Gamble, the world’s biggest consumer products company, said on Thursday that its chief executive had resigned and was being replaced by his predecessor, Alan G. Lafley.

headline.main: Abruptly, P.&G. Chief Ends Career of 33 Years
headline.print_headline: Abruptly, P.&G. Chief Ends Career Of 33 Years

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Procter & Gamble said on Thursday that its chief executive, Robert A. McDonald, had resigned. | Four executives of SAC Capital Advisors have received subpoenas to testify before a grand jury. | In a push to soften financial regulations, bank lobbyists are helping lawmakers draft legislation. | Congressional concern over SoftBank’s bid for Sprint Nextel is growing.
snippet: Procter & Gamble said on Thursday that its chief executive, Robert A. McDonald, had resigned. | Four executives of SAC Capital Advisors have received subpoenas to testify before a grand jury. | In a push to soften financial regulations, bank lobby...
lead_paragraph: P.&G. CHIEF IS OUT  |  Procter & Gamble, a company that is one of the biggest holdings of the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman, said on Thursday that its chief executive, Robert A. McDonald, had resigned. Mr. McDonald is being succeeded by his predecessor, Alan G. Lafley, The New York Times’s Michael J. de la Merced reports.

abstract: The departure of Robert McDonald as Procter & Gamble’s chief executive was yet another victory for the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman. But how is the activist investor doing in his other big bets?
snippet: The departure of Robert McDonald as Procter & Gamble’s chief executive was yet another victory for the hedge fund manager William A. Ackman. But how is the activist investor doing in his other big bets?
lead_paragraph: With the departure of Robert McDonald as Procter & Gamble’s chief executive, William A. Ackman has collected another big-game trophy.

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced
